entry.title: Redirect VolumeManager to original profile for incognito
entry.content:
GuestOS filesystems always mount with the original profile, so

they are not currently visible when using incognito FilesApp.



We should always have a single VolumeManager shared between regular

and incognito for all volume types.



This implements change as discussed in http://crbug.com/1383113#c21



Undoes code from http://crrev.com/c/3865352 where GuestOsMountProvider

was updated to support multiple VolumeManagers in incognito.



Bug: b/291522112

entry.title: [Exo]SurfaceTreeHost owns the frame_sink and drives surface_id update
entry.content:
SurfaceTreeHost will update the child portion of the surface_id when it

sees the scale_factor or rect of the next compositor frame change, and

immediately synchronize to host_window()->layer() that embeds the

surface draw quad. Skipping the OnSurfaceActivation IPC from Viz to

host_window() to embed a new surface.



host_window()->GetSurfaceId() may update the parent portion of the

surface_id but it shall only be sync'ed to the SurfaceTreeHost's

frame_sink when a configure is acknowledged.



This prevents unexpected resource being held by viz when host_window

properties(bounds/scale) change.



Bug: 1251778

Change-Id: I2eec337337fed7ec77488b535368ed3355a87ee7

entry.title: ozone/wayland: Set clip rect from augmented_surface
entry.content:
This CL lets WaylandFrameManager use augmented_surface_set_clip instead

of augmented_sub_surface_set_clip, which means, we set clip rect on

local surface coordinates instead of parent surface.



This is a client side implementation.

Server side implementation is done in crrev.com/c/4692717.



This is a part of window jitter fix.

entry.title: Exo: Handle clip rect on local surface coordinate on server
entry.content:
This CL introduces augmented_surface_set_clip which uses local surface

coordinates for clip rect to unblock clip delegation.

`clip_rect` was not adjusted to the correct coordinates when host window

origin is not (0, 0). This change allows us to adjust the coordinates

correctly inside surface hierarchy.



We used to use augmented_sub_surface_set_clip where the clip rect is set

on parent surface coordinates, and we still support this protocol for

now.



This CL does not change the behavior yet as the newly introduced

protocol is not yet used by client side.

This is part of window jitter fix.



Bug: 1457446, 1385509

Change-Id: Iaa0f9ae1fa4fd594bfa1f0d4ef9c3a09c338a366

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4692717

Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima

entry.title: [Refactoring] Merge DnsConfigServiceAndroid::Watcher to DnsConfigServiceAndroid
entry.content:
DnsConfigServiceAndroid::Watcher inherits DnsConfigService::Watcher,

which is an abstract class and is used to call base DnsConfigService

functions.

Since DnsConfigServiceAndroid::Watcher is used only from

DnsConfigServiceAndroid, it is good to implement the functions on

DnsConfigServiceAndroid directly to reduce code complexity.



This CL also removes unused function DnsConfigServiceAndroid::Watcher

::OnConfigChangedDelayed().

entry.title: Split build target of /c/common/url_constants
entry.content:
Move /c/common/url_constants.* and webui_url_constants.* to

/c/common:url_constants, so it can be a depended from build targets

under /c/common/.

Also clean up some public dependencies.



Note that they are not moved to /c/common:constants because that

target has external dependents and will cause link issues. Create a

new target to minimize the impact to the existing targets.

entry.title: [iOS] actionSheetCoordinator stopped when dismissed
entry.content:
According to ChromeCoordinator invariant, all coordinators should be

stopped before being deallocated. This CL ensures that whatever the user chose, the coordinator is stopped; whatever button they tap.



In ActionSheetCoordinator, a cancel item is always added.

So adding this cancel element is not adding a new item, it‚Äôs only

ensuring it stops the coordinator

entry.title: WebUI: Delete obsolete a11y tests based on js2gtest, part 3 (last).
entry.content:
In this part deleting the AccessibilityTest base class and all

surrounding code.



The WebUI AccessibilityTest mechanism is being removed, since it has

not proven very useful, is basically abandoned for a long time and

relies on js2gtest which WebUI tests are moving away from. Porting it

off of js2gtest does not seem like a good time investment, given that

such tests have not proven to be useful. Therefore removal seems

to be the most practical and appropriate option to unblock the removal

of js2gtest.

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Handle timestamps in V4L2StatefulVD decoding
entry.content:
This CL handles the timestamps during decoding in V4L2StatefulVD,

namely stores the incoming DecoderBuffer timestamp and uses it to

tag the produced decoded VideoFrame. V4L2 uses struct timevals

while Chrome likes base:TimeDelta, so this CL adds two helper

functions in v4l2_utils.cc to translate back and forth.

entry.title: guest_os: Check DLC state prior to requesting installation
entry.content:
Check DLC state prior to requesting installation, and skip installation

if the DLC is already installed. The DLC service client enforces a 3

second delay between sequential installs, even if the DLCs are already

installed. By avoiding the install request, Bruschetta terminal tabs can

open without delay.



This achieves a similar result to crrev.com/c/4692503 but is a more

generic solution.

entry.title: [Chromecast] Limit the size of pulled audio buffer

If the audio output pulls too much buffer from audio renderer, it will

break the av sync logic. So for streams with both audio and video, we

should limit the size of the pulled buffers.

entry.title: Use 443 port for GloballyReachableCheck
entry.content:
Currently, Chromium opens a UDP socket on port 53 to check for

reachability. However, some security software monitor Chromium's

activity and may block network requests from Chromium when they detect

that Chromium is opening multiple UDP sockets on port 53.



This CL changes Chromium to open a UDP socket on port 443 instead of

port 53. Port 443 is commonly used for QUIC, so we expect that this

change will mitigate the issue with security software.



Bug: 1403182

Change-Id: Ie8ccd21c00be2d8421ef9435d328c14f1abbedbb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4678925

Reviewed-by: Eric Orth

entry.content:
The js2gtest based WebUI tests are only registered when include_js_tests

is true, which excludes builds like is_asan, is_msan, is_tsan and

is_cfi.



As part of migrating tests off of js2gtest, the new tests were not

guarded by the same flag. While this does not seem to have caused any

issues (have not seen any reports of tests failing in such bots), it is

best to not affect which bots run which tests during the migration.



Bug: 1457360

entry.title: shortcuts: Add DomKey fallback for generating the key display
entry.content:
There are now three total ways on resolving a keycode to a readable

string:

1. Convert keyCode to localized/positioned domcode and get the Domkey

2. Get the non-localized domcode and get the non-localized domcode

mapping

3. (New) Iterate through Domkey mappings and return the found

non-localized string



Bug: b/216049298

Test: ash_webui_unittests

entry.title: lacros: Reset PrefsAshObserver in PostDestroyThreads
entry.content:
PrefService `local_state_` is reset on `browser_process_` dtor called

inside ChromeBrowserMainParts::PostDestroyThreads [1], so we can

reset PrefsAshObserver in

ChromeBrowserMainPartsLacros::PostDestroyThreads to avoid accessing

destroyed PrefService from `prefs_ash_observer_`.



[1]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:chrome/browser/chrome_browser_main.cc;l=2010;drc=c3f32fac9e8a61bf1e1c54c1022a96af097cf687

entry.title: [viz] Don't delay surface activation or draw on non-interactive clients
entry.content:
In this CL we do as khushalsagar@ suggested on the bug and plumb a bit

with the compositor frame to let viz know whether it is part of an

interaction (i.e., if it's due to scrolling).



In addition to avoiding a delay when drawing, this CL goes a bit

further and also prevents delaying surface activation.



Bug: 1082569

entry.title: cros_next: add blurred background to pill button
entry.content:
Sometimes the pill buttons need the background blur effect to make

the label more clear. Directly setting background blur to pill

button's layer will make all the rectangle area blur. Setting

rounded corner radius to the layer will clip the contents of the

button and its children. For example, the focus ring will be

clipped. Therefore, we should set a separate background shield to

the button for the background blur effect.



Background blur is performance consuming so we should make it

optional and only enable it as needed.



This CL adds a BlurredBackgroundShield variable to the PillButton.

When background blur is enabled, the blurred background shield will

replace the button's background.



The final effects are shown in the bug comments.



Bug: b:277915834

trial (https://uma.googleplex.com/p/chrome/variations?sid=2ff889a349a16d6456b729e2b0674d42)

entry.title: gardening: Revert "[webauthn] Always filter passkeys by allow-list"
entry.content:
This reverts commit a0e7eaa16dd8d6b9943e19c2098f2f77d376c6d2.



Reason for revert: browser test is flaky on Mac



Original change's description:

> [webauthn] Always filter passkeys by allow-list

>

> When servicing a webauthn request, chrome requests discoverable

> credential metadata matching the request from local authenticators.

> These are filtered to match the request's allow list. However, GPM

> passkeys are obtained directly from sync, so they are not being

> filtered, which causes chrome to display passkeys that are not eligible

> for the request.

>

> ChromeAuthenticatorRequestDelegate's credential_filter_ already filters

> all credentials after they are discovered, but only for conditional

> requests. This CL expands that behaviour to cover modal requests as

> well, which fixes the bug.

>

entry.title: Enable the consistently passing tests in SharedWorkerServiceImplTest
entry.content:
This change is part of the effort to re-enable consistently passing

tests across the entire chromium.

If the tests are reasonable, please LGTM and I will proceed to submit

the change.

If the tests are unreasonable, please let me know and I will remove

them.





------ How the change is created ------



I do not inspect each individual test case, the idea is to run the

disabled tests on reviver builders

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/g/reviver/builders and use the

aggregated results to decide if a previously disabled test is now

consistently passing.



Usually I create changes by directly enabling the tests. If the tests

are failing on platforms not covered by the reviver builders or

explicitly mentioned in the associated bugs, I may conditionally

enable them on certain platforms.

But other than that, I won't include extra changes except for the

ones suggested by `git cl format`.





------ How to inspect the reviver builder results ------



You may choose a platform you are interested,

e.g. chromium/reviver/lacros-coordinator.

[link: https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/reviver/lacros-coordinator]

In the baseline builder / buildbucket.schedule step, e.g.

chromium/ci/linux-lacros-builder-rel - buildbucket.schedule,

there will be a luci run link.

[ex: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/reviver/runner/b8776966777608450081/overview]





------ Aggregated results of the tests involved ------



The following list shows how many times the changed tests were

*consistently* passing on the relevant builders.



content/test:content_unittests/SharedWorkerServiceImplTest.WebContentsDestroyed

127 fuchsia-fyi-arm64-dbg

150 fuchsia-fyi-x64-dbg

192 fuchsia-x64-rel

110 linux-lacros-tester-rel



data version: 2023-06-28 16:45:51

entry.title: FSA: Support multiple shared lock modes
entry.content:
Updates the FileSystemAccessLockManager to support multiple types of

shared modes. Each mode is exclusive to each other. You can open

multiple locks on a file of the same shared mode, but you cannot open

locks on the same file with different shared modes. There is a special

exclusive mode which only allows one lock to be open on the file.



There should be no behavioral changes.



Bug: 1382215

entry.title: [Test Automation] Observe states and wait for state changes
entry.content:
Lets you observe asynchronous world/browser state as part of a test, so that you can wait for a particular state or value rather than trying to emit events and catch them at precisely the right time.



Ppreviously you might need to do some weird parallel nonsense if

you didn't know when an event would come in, but it was a blocker to

proceeding with the test.



To wait for a state, create a StateObserver class, and start watching with `ObserveState(state_id, make_unique())`.



Then use `WaitForState(state_id, value)` or `WaitForStateMatch(state_id, value_matcher)` to wait for the state value you want.



Change-Id: Ie1de10f851e9f70f0172086d9089c16c094d9490

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4693923

Code-Coverage: Findit

entry.title: [iOS] Add initial Overflow Menu Destination Customization UI
entry.content:
This CL adds the initial UI for customization the order and show/hide

state of the destinations in the Overflow Menu UI. It uses the Apple-

provided drag/drop APIs to allow dragging destinations and dropping them

elsewhere in the destinations list (reordering) or a "Drop to hide"

target area (hiding).



There is more work here for the UI, including:

- Renaming the ActionCustomization* files to just Customization* as

they are no longer action specific.

- Showing full row UI for the hidden destinations (including button

to re-show).

- Add custom UTType so external drags are ignored.

- All model interactions

- Final strings



Demo: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nUMWsN86O5W_EljIxV9FkAp7A0eWkIqM/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-10ipUk74FAj4VfSSVWEg5Q

entry.title: Add severity variant to ChromeOS.Stability
entry.content:
Include "Unknown_enum_value" as a severity variant and

CrashSeverityProductType, which signifies that the value being uploaded

to UMA is not expected.



We are logging this to UMA to be consistent with crash/ as this value

can appear in crash reports.



The client side logic is here: crrev.com/c/4692301.

entry.title: Only check kEnableMSAAOnNewIntelGPUs on eligible devices
entry.content:
Currently, only a small percentage of host devices are affected by the

experiment kEnableMSAAOnNewIntelGPUs. UMA does not provide the

necessary fields to filter results by Intel GPU generation ID, and

filtering by DeviceID is too tedious for practical analysis.



The purpose of this change is to modify the logic that checks the

experiment flag so that the experiment config can run with

starts_active = false in order to only enroll clients whose devices

are eligible for the experiment. This should allow the experiment

to produce clearer results with a higher degree of statistical

significance.



Bug: 1341830

Change-Id: I9cee90cbe1f6664d498dee93c147aa0b22706ff8

entry.title: [Fuchsia] Add ASAN_OPTIONS in asan build
entry.content:
fuchsia-fyi-x64-asan build is broken due to detect_odr_violation in

rust.[1] and search for "odr-violation" in [2].



It's a known issue [3] and also impacts other platforms [4].



A previous attempt to disable the

sanitize-address-globals-dead-stripping

(in https://crrev.com/c/4690811) fixed media_unittests but broke

base_unittests. So I ended up deciding to follow the suggestion from

the sanitizer itself to use the environment variable.



Since there isn't a asan try, it takes 6+ hours to run, I have to

manually test the change locally. With this change, both media_unittests

and base_unittests are passing when is_asan = true in gn args.



[1]: https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/task?id=6360bb22591abb10

[2]: https://cas-viewer.appspot.com/projects/chromium-swarm/instances/default_instance/blobs/be139e3b5b49518b8a83be3fcdc5c209dc2acc2c9f725c558dd3fc2aac93a558/404237?filename=emulator_log.serial

[3]: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/113404

[4]: https://crbug.com/1459233



Bug: 1459233, 1465997

Change-Id: I36fcbb947f87bafaa618bb5de5d631ad895a1bac

entry.title: Clarify GetProxyToOuterDelegate comment
entry.content:
The preposition "to" is being used inconsistently here such that the

comment is describing the opposite of what the method does. We reword

this to make it explicit that the proxy is representing `this` and the

SiteInstance that it's for is the outer document's.
